H7703.def: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process

H898.def: = pattern of behavior by which humans act in a way which shows a lack of truthfulness and commitment, both in words and deeds

H8552.def: = process by which events reach the stage of completion

H5239.def: = action by which humans stop engaging in a certain activity

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H2603.def: = state in which humans or deities are favorably disposed to (other) humans, and act accordingly

H6960.def: = state in which humans are confident that their longing will be fulfilled

H2220.def: = each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈  directly associated with strength and power

H1242.def: = first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil

H637.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H3444.def: = causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H6869.def: = a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape

H5074.def: = action by which humans or animals move away in haste from a certain place ► in order to escape from a situation that is considered dangerous

H1995.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects produce a variety of sounds, sometimes associated with natural phenomena like heavy rain and the waves of a stormy sea

H622.def: = process by which humans come together from different places and form a group for a common purpose, such as for a meeting or for war

H2625.def: exact meaning unkown; probably: = juvenile form of {L:locust<SDBH:אַרְבֶּה>}

H625.def: = act of bringing in crops from the field at the time of harvest

H4944.def: = process by which animals move forward at great speed and with aggressive intent

H1357.def: = a depression at the bottom of a waterbody, ► where water can still be found even when most of the water has dried up

H8264.def: = process by which animals move forward at great speed and with aggressive intent

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H4791.def: = a position of a relatively high elevation above the earth

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H6726.def: = mountain; ► that part of {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>} on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, YHWH's dwelling place

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H530.def: = state in which an object does not move

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H2633.def: = objects that are considered valuable to have

H3444.def: = causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H1847.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H3374.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H214.def: = valuable goods in one's possession; ≈ falsely considered a source of well-being

H691.def: = soldier known for his extreme bravery, strength, and/or ability to fight; ◄ compared to a lion

H2351.def: = referent to the location outside of an object

H4397.def: = a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else

H1058.def: = action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person

H4751.def: = a small quantity of a liquid

H4546.def: = a relatively wide road or access ramp made by by covering the surface of the ground with thicks layers of sand

H8074.def: = state in which an area has become empty as a result of destruction and depopulation

H734.def: = relatively narrow {L:road<SDBH:דֶּרֶךְ>} that connects two locations and facilitates travelling

H7673.def: = process by which an activity comes to an end

H1285.def: = a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H3988.def: = state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events

H2803.def: = action by which humans exercise their {L:mind<SDBH:לֵב>} with regard to something

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H56.def: = to experience grief and show this by one's actions; ◄ caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances

H535.def: = state of being unable to function as can be expected; ◄ as a result of destruction, a drought, or God's direct intervention; ► results include weakness, sadness, shame, death, and disintegration, depending on the situation

H3844.def: = range of mountains; ◄ north of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; ► known for the {L:cedar<SDBH:אֶרֶז>} and other trees growing there

H2659.def: = action by which animals strike the ground with their feet

H7060.def: = process by which plants dry up and die ◄ for lack of water; usually associated with grief, hardship, and punishment from God

H8289.def: = plain; ◄ along the coast of the Mediterranean

H1316.def: = region; ◄ north-east of the River {L:Jordan<SDBH:יַרְדֵּן>}, ► at one time ruled by king {L:Og<SDBH:עֹוג>}, later assigned to half of the tribe of {L:Manasseh<SDBH:מְנַשֶּׁה>}

H3760.def: = newly ripened grain which has just been harvested and which has not yet been dried for storage or for grinding into flour

H5287.def: = action by which animals produce a full, deep, prolonged sound as made by a lion; ≈ associated with aggression, but also with suffering

H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H2029.def: = process by which someone becomes pregnant

H2842.def: meaning unsure; either: (1) = dried grass or leaves; ► useless, ≈ and considered of little value; or: (2) = the husks of grain or other seed, separated by winnowing or threshing; ► useless, ≈ and considered of little value

H7179.def: = dry grass-like remnant of wheat or another grain crop following the harvest; this term possibly refers to two kinds of material, one being the remnant of the crop remaining in the ground, the other being the unwanted residue of stalks; ► only used for brick making; ≈ usually considered of little value and needing to be separated from the grain itself; maybe burned

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H4955.def: = causative process by which humans cause an object to be consumed by fire

H7875.def: = substance produced by burning limestone or other materials containing calcium; ► mixed with water to produce whitewash

H6975.def: = small shrub with thorns; ≈ associated with things of no value, aggression, and destruction

H3683.def: = causative action by which humans remove a relatively large plant or tree from its trunk with a sharp tool

H3341.def: = action by which someone causes something to start burning, usually with effects on people and nature around; ≈ associated with punishment and judgement

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H1369.def: = the ability to accomplish great things because of characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

H2400.def: = state in which a human being is responsible for a specified or implied offence, ► which results in a state of guilt which may require atonement, restitution, and retribution

H6726.def: = mountain; ► that part of {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>} on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, YHWH's dwelling place

H6342.def: = process by which humans tremble or shake, ◄ as a result of strong emotions of joy, awe, or fear

H2611.def: = state in which humans are impure in character, without regard or respect for God

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H1481.def: = state in which humans live in a place that is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H4168.def: = iron framework; ◄ part of an altar or fire-place; ► location where objects are burned; ≈ associated with fire

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H4339.def: = state in which an object has a relativedly flat surface, where people and objects can move without obstacles; ≈ associated with security and prosperity

H3988.def: = state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events

H1215.def: = possessions accumulated through advantageous transactions, in which part of the income can be kept for oneself, mostly achieved in an unjust way

H4642.def: = action by which humans mistreat other humans

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

H5287.def: = action by which animals produce a full, deep, prolonged sound as made by a lion; ≈ associated with aggression, but also with suffering

H7810.def: = an object, usually of some value, given to a person; ► can be given without any expectation of exchange or often with the purpose to influence or persuade another person

H331.def: exact meaning unsure; probably: = state of being covered by a structure or pattern consisting of strips crossing each other with square or diamond-shaped spaces left between

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H1818.def: = red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of {L:life<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>}; human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land

H6105.def: = state in which humans are numerous and therefore potentially powerful

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

22.gl: to make a sign of refusal

H4791.def: = a position of a relatively high elevation above the earth

H4679.def: = animal hunted by humans or other animals ► for food; ≈ often extended metaphorically to people

H4869.def: = a high and therefore unattainable location, either because of its natural environment or as a result of human construction efforts, ≈ associated with security and protection from the enemy

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H539.def: = state in which an inanimate object is firmly positioned in its place, so that it will not move

H2372.def: = process by which someone perceives an important object with the eyes, or witnesses an event of some significance

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H3308.def: = state in which the outward appearance of humans or objects is pleasing to the eye

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H4801.def: = state in which humans, deities, objects, or events are located in a place that is at a relatively great distance from the point of reference

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H1897.def: = causative action by which humans causes other humans or objects to be removed from their place,◄ as if by blowing them away

H367.def: = state of strong fear because of an actual or perceived danger, such as aggression from the enemy, a dangerous animal, or death

H346.def: = a reference to an unknown location; normally used with the purpose of finding out which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found

H8254.def: = action by which humans determine the weight of an object, which is usually done with the help of a balance (scales)

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4026.def: = relatively high structure made of stone; ► used for guarding the surrounding area and/or for providing protection against hostile forces from outside; ≈ associated with security and protection

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H3267.def: meaning unsure; possibly: = state in which humans are overly confident

H6012.def: literally: deep of tongue; hence: = state in which people speak a language that others find hard to understand

H3932.def: only used in poetry; = action by which humans or deities express their disdain of others with words, sounds and/or gestures

H3956.def: = the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H998.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H2372.def: = process by which someone perceives an important object with the eyes, or witnesses an event of some significance

H6726.def: = mountain; ► that part of {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>} on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, YHWH's dwelling place

H7151.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H4150.def: = an action by which two or more parties come together for a particular purpose

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H7600.def: = state in which humans live a peaceful life and have nothing to fear, which can easily lead to carelessness and arrogance

H168.def: = construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary

H1077.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H6813.def: = process by which an object is moved from one place to another

H3489.def: = small, pointed object ► driven into a wall or the ground and used for hanging things on or securing something in place; ≈ associated with firmness and security

H5331.def: poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future

H5265.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from another object into which it had been inserted or attached in a different way

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H117.def: = pertaining to inspiring awe and respect ◄ because of one's beauty, size, strength, or status

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H4725.def: = a specific area or point in space

H7342.def: = state in which an object is large in size

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H2975.def: = a river ◄ flowing through Egypt from south to north; ► overflowing its banks each year and providing fertility for the fields on both sides; ≈ generally associated with Egypt's power and prosperity

H1077.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H590.def: = a group of relatively large ships sailing together and usually owned by one single person

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H6716.def: = boat of a relatively large size; ► able to sail the sea and ocean

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H2710.def: = action by which humans reproduce the form or shape of an object on another object; ◄ by carving, drawing, writing, etc.; ► for the purpose of decoration, communication, sometimes as preparation for a new construction

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H3467.def: = action by which humans or deities help themselves in a (difficult) situation

H5203.def: = process by which ropes that used to be tightly strung begin to hang loose

H1077.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H2388.def: = state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense, or simply in their ability to convince others with words

H8650.def: = pole; ► used to carry a banner

H6566.def: = causative action by which humans spread out an object, such as a piece of cloth, a net, or a document either horizontally or vertically

H5251.def: = a distinctive object in the form of a flag or board attached to a stick, or a metal device or image fitted on the end of a pole; ► normally used to identify a particular group, or as a rallying point for soldiers in war; ≈ often used figuratively to denote an example, or a person or deity that one can rely on, or something that shows the way

H227.def: = referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future

H4766.def: = state in which objects are many in quantity

H5706.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H2505.def: = causative action by which humans or deities divide an object (or range of objects) into portions; ► usually with the intention to use one or more of these portions for a particular purpose

H6455.def: = state in which humans or animals are disabled in one of their legs or feet, ► and so have difficulty walking

H962.def: = action by which someone takes all sorts of goods (including people and animals) by force from an enemy in war

H957.def: = all sorts of goods, taken forcibly from an enemy in war

H1077.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H2470.def: = process by which humans lose their physical strength ◄ as a result of sickness, injury, a prolonged exertion of strength, or other circumstances

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
